docs.snippet: It would seem to take an act of will for the delicately mellow chocolate mousse at Il Forno, a new bakery at 400 West 50th Street, to hold its shape as a cake. Consisting of little besides excellent rich chocolate mousse, it delivers an irrefutabl...
docs.abstract: Forno, new Manhattan bakery, makes delicately mellow chocolate mousse cake; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: It would seem to take an act of will for the delicately mellow chocolate mousse at Il Forno, a new bakery at 400 West 50th Street, to hold its shape as a cake. Consisting of little besides excellent rich chocolate mousse, it delivers an irrefutable argument for simplicity. The mousse cake is $3.25 a slice and $29 for a whole cake, which serves 12. None of the other items sold in this bakery, which makes the desserts for La Locanda, an Italian restaurant around the corner at 737 Ninth Avenue, are particularly fussy, either. Whipped cream? It comes thickly sandwiched between flaky pastry layers in a napoleon or swiped with chocolate and swirled in a cream puff. Custard? You'll find it slathered as the filling for the pine-nut-strewn torta alla nonna.

headline.main: This Mousse Cake Needs No Bells or Whistles

docs.snippet: Tired of the same old balsamico? Sal-Mar's port wine vinegar from Portugal is ruby-colored and mellow and has a sweet aftertaste and a winy richness. It is excellent combined with a light but fruity olive oil for salad, especially one with a bitte...
docs.abstract: Food Stuff column recomends Sal de Mar's port wine vinegar from Portugal; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Tired of the same old balsamico? Sal-Mar's port wine vinegar from Portugal is ruby-colored and mellow and has a sweet aftertaste and a winy richness. It is excellent combined with a light but fruity olive oil for salad, especially one with a bitter ingredient like radicchio. The vinegar also makes an intriguing cookie to serve with a glass of port. Cream one stick butter with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 3/4 cup sugar. Add a beaten egg and 2 tablespoons of the vinegar. Fold in 1 1/2 cups flour mixed with 1/4 teaspoon baking powder. Mix in 1/2 cup chopped toasted almonds. Drop by scant tablespoonfuls on baking sheets lined with parchment paper; lightly flatten the mounds, and bake on the upper rack of the oven at 350 degrees about 15 minutes, until browned around the edges.

headline.main: Vinegar From Port: It's Almost Worth Decanting

docs.snippet: When Pamela and Alan Rice were thinking of opening a beer store in the East 80s, some of their friends -- whose short memories did not register that the neighborhood, Yorkville, was once home to numerous German and Eastern European beer halls -- t...
docs.abstract: City Swiggers on the Upper East Side, is a new beer shop and tap room that has become a magnet for beer lovers; growing inventory offers close to 400 choices. Photo (M)
docs.news_desk: Dining In, Dining Out / Style Desk
docs.lead_paragraph: When Pamela and Alan Rice were thinking of opening a beer store in the East 80s, some of their friends -- whose short memories did not register that the neighborhood, Yorkville, was once home to numerous German and Eastern European beer halls -- tried to discourage them. ''They said that the Upper East Side is too upscale for beer, and people drink wine,'' Ms. Rice said. The Rices, both career-changers, went ahead anyway, with happy results. Since opening two weeks ago, their shop and bar, City Swiggers, has been a magnet for beer-lovers, many of them locals. ''We have people coming in with strollers,'' he said.

headline.main: Bavaria Returns to the Upper East Side

docs.snippet: The Santa Maria Novella pharmacy in Florence, Italy, is known for its perfumes and herb- and spice-based items, like candles. Now it has introduced small boxes of elegant wrapped chocolates.      Fragrant rose-flavored dark chocolate and refreshin...
docs.abstract: Santa Maria Novella pharmacy in Florence, Italy, has introduced small boxes of elegant wrapped chocolates; photo (Food Stuff column) (S)
docs.news_desk: Dining In, Dining Out / Style Desk
docs.lead_paragraph: The Santa Maria Novella pharmacy in Florence, Italy, is known for its perfumes and herb- and spice-based items, like candles. Now it has introduced small boxes of elegant wrapped chocolates. Fragrant rose-flavored dark chocolate and refreshing citrus-flavored milk chocolate, in boxes of 18 pieces for $37, are sold in the Lafco boutique at 285 Lafayette Street (Houston Street), (800) 362-3677.

headline.main: Get Some Aromatherapy With Your Chocolate

docs.snippet: Commerce, a contemporary American restaurant that is to open tomorrow at 50 Commerce Street (Barrow Street), has inherited a legacy. The building dates from 1911; the restaurant space was a speakeasy during Prohibition, and in 1941 it became the B...
docs.abstract: Commerce restaurant is set to open in Lower Manhattan building that dates from 1911; will incorporate elements that reflect its past, including mural by David Joel; drawing (Food Stuff column) (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Commerce, a contemporary American restaurant that is to open tomorrow at 50 Commerce Street (Barrow Street), has inherited a legacy. The building dates from 1911; the restaurant space was a speakeasy during Prohibition, and in 1941 it became the Blue Mill Tavern. In 1992, it was sold to restaurateurs who turned it into Grange Hall. In 2004, under more new owners, it briefly reverted to Blue Mill Tavern. Now the space will incorporate design elements that reflect its past. The owners, Tony Zazula and Harold Moore, commissioned David Joel, who had painted a mural in 1993 for the owners of Grange Hall (which they removed when they left), to create a new one. In oil and gold leaf, and measuring 4 by 16 feet, it is similar to the previous work, depicting sleepy workers after a harvest. Mr. Zazula also found a 1941 Art Deco bar.

headline.main: For a New Restaurant, Homage to History

docs.snippet: With its white tiles, vintage detailing and tenement-green bagel case, Zucker's Bagels and Smoked Fish, which just opened in TriBeCa, has a properly dated look to suggest it has been around almost as long as such New York icons as Russ & Daughters...
docs.abstract: Florence Fabricant reviews Zucker's Bagels and Smoked Fish restaurant in TriBeCa; photo (Food Stuff column) (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: With its white tiles, vintage detailing and tenement-green bagel case, Zucker's Bagels and Smoked Fish, which just opened in TriBeCa, has a properly dated look to suggest it has been around almost as long as such New York icons as Russ & Daughters (since 1914) and Barney Greengrass (since 1908). The architect, Glen Coben, has even hung a weathered carved sturgeon on the sign outside. The menu of smoked fish, salads and delicatessen meats sold here does not stray from the tried and true, and is much the same as at Murray's Bagels in Chelsea, which like Zucker's is owned by Matt Pomerantz. But here he offers smoked wild Pacific Coho salmon in addition to sockeye and king, and serves a few more egg dishes for brunch. There is a counter for a quick bite and several simple wood tables in the dining area.

headline.main: A Smoked Fish Spot in TriBeCa Cultivates a Last-Century Vibe

docs.snippet: Bowery Kitchen Supplies will open Bowery Kitchen East, specializing in knives and chef's clothing, Friday, just a few steps from the Bowery. And if you've ever wondered why the larger parent store in the Chelsea Market has Bowery in its name, it's...
docs.abstract: Bowery Kitchen, kitchen supply store, opens on Rivington Street; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Bowery Kitchen Supplies will open Bowery Kitchen East, specializing in knives and chef's clothing, Friday, just a few steps from the Bowery. And if you've ever wondered why the larger parent store in the Chelsea Market has Bowery in its name, it's because Howard Nourieli, an owner, had a store on the Bowery for about 10 years before moving to Chelsea in 1996. Now he is back in the old neighborhood, offering a broad range of cutting utensils. The knives, mostly from Germany and Japan, start at $30 and go up into the thousands. There are excellent light, dishwasher-safe Epicurean cutting surfaces made from pressed board, too, starting at about $10, including a generous oblong for fish ($34). Another specialty is cocktail-making equipment: 5 Rivington Street (Bowery), (212) 477-8681.

headline.main: A New Bowery Kitchen, Just Steps From Its Namesake

docs.snippet: The Farmers' Museum in Cooperstown, N.Y., has a sure crowd-pleasing exhibition on view until the end of October: ''Ice Cream: Our Cool Obsession.'' There are photographs, historical artifacts like antique ice cream machines and old trucks, and a r...
docs.abstract: Cooperstown, NY, Farmers' Museum opens exhibit on ice cream; drawings; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The Farmers' Museum in Cooperstown, N.Y., has a sure crowd-pleasing exhibition on view until the end of October: ''Ice Cream: Our Cool Obsession.'' There are photographs, historical artifacts like antique ice cream machines and old trucks, and a retro ice cream parlor serving treats. The history of the confection, starting with water ices in ancient times, is explored. The museum, 5775 State Highway 80 (Lake Road), Cooperstown, is in a colonial-style stone barn and is open daily; admission is $11 for adults, $9.50 for those 65 and older, $5 for children 7 to 12 and free for younger children and members. Hours vary: (888) 547-1450.

headline.main: A Crowd-Pleaser of a Trip And a Book to Try at Home

docs.snippet: Wild fennel is commonplace in Sicily, where it is used in a springtime pasta dish with fresh sardines, currants, pine nuts and toasted bread crumbs.      Now, with wild fennel from California available for about two weeks, pasta con le sarde, as t...
docs.abstract: Fresh fennel from California is now available at some upscale New York City food markets; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Wild fennel is commonplace in Sicily, where it is used in a springtime pasta dish with fresh sardines, currants, pine nuts and toasted bread crumbs. Now, with wild fennel from California available for about two weeks, pasta con le sarde, as the dish is called, can be made here.
